title: James Van Der Beek passes away at 48 after battle with colorectal cancer
description: US actor James Van Der Beek, the star of the American TV series "Dawson's Creek," died on Wednesday at age 48 after a battle with colorectal cancer.  While he also had roles in the films "Varsity Blues" and "The Rules of Attraction," Van Der Beek never truly established himself in cinema as he struggled to separate himself from the legacy of "Dawson's Creek."

title: 'Gave poisoned laddoos': How ‘mystical healer’ preyed on greed and left a trail of deaths in Delhi
description: A 72-year-old occultist, Kamruddin, has been arrested for allegedly poisoning three people with laddoos in Delhi. Cops describe him as a habitual offender with a criminal history in Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan, including at least two prior murder cases. He preyed on victims by promising mystical solutions and wealth, extorting money before administering poison.

title: Alix Earle hints at rumored romance with Tom Brady as insiders reveal what happened between the two

title: 'I quit, as ChatGPT-maker...': Top researcher Zoe Hitzig at Sam Altman's company
description: OpenAI's top researcher Zoe Hitzig resigned, citing concerns over the company's decision to test ads in ChatGPT. She warned that the vast trove of private user data collected by ChatGPT could be exploited for manipulation, drawing parallels to Facebook's past privacy issues. Hitzig proposed alternative models for AI companies to avoid such pitfalls.

The leaders also addressed the Gaza conflict and broader Middle East instability, with international calls for restraint amid regional tensions.

description: Congress has intensified its criticism of Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri regarding his alleged connections with financier Jeffrey Epstein. Party leader Pawan Khera questioned Puri's interactions, citing an email exchange suggesting Epstein facilitated a meeting with Reid Hoffman. Khera also condemned Puri's remarks on Epstein's conviction, accusing him of trivializing child sexual exploitation and demanding moral clarity from public officials.

title: Cartel drones, military activity: Chaos at US border town after airspace shut, then reopened
description: The FAA has imposed a 10-day flight restriction over El Paso International Airport and parts of southern New Mexico due to "special security reasons." All flights are grounded, with the federal government warning of potential deadly force against any aircraft violating the restricted airspace. Officials expressed surprise and lack of clear information regarding the unprecedented shutdown.

title: More US, Venezuelan crude to flow into India? Economic viability in doubt
description: Practical constraints limit the scale at which Indian refiners can replace existing supplies with oil from the United States or Venezuela. US crude is typically light and sweet, meaning it has lower sulphur content, while many Indian refineries are configured to process medium-grade crude.

War on H-1B: New 'Exile' Bill aims to eliminate visa by next year
Bank strike on February 12: Will banks remain open or closed tomorrow? Why bank unions are striking
description: Bank unions across India have announced a nationwide strike on February 12, protesting the government's new Labour Codes.  Customers face uncertainty as major banks warn of potential operational disruptions, though they are making arrangements for smooth functioning. Unions also advocate for improved work-life balance and a five-day work week.

title: Connor McDavid’s wife Lauren Kyle turns heads in Milan ahead of Olympic opener
description: Connor McDavid and Team Canada have arrived in Milan for the 2026 Winter Olympics, beginning preparations for their opener against Czechia. McDavid skated on the top line in practice and shared candid remarks about the Olympic Village and adjusting to jet lag. Off the ice, Lauren Kyle’s Instagram posts offered fans a personal look at life in Milan, highlighting family support and national pride. Canada, led by captain Sidney Crosby, aims to build on last year’s international success as Olympic competition begins.

title: Erika Kirk addresses backlash as Bad Bunny’s show outshines TPUSA event
description: Erika Kirk spoke out after Turning Point USA aired its alternative Super Bowl LX halftime show honoring her late husband, Charlie Kirk. The broadcast featured a tribute montage and patriotic performances, claiming millions of viewers despite streaming restrictions. While Bad Bunny headlined the official NFL show, the rival event blended politics, grief, and culture into a deeply emotional night.

title: Antimicrobial resistance: Charles Darwin was right; India’s drug policy isn’t
description: Antibiotics aren’t only pharmacological agents: they are evolutionary interventions that reshape microbial populations wherever they are deployed
